Non-standart (template) letters
you can find here (you can copy and paste in your document):

©   -   Example: <S©L:1:"select USER,ID from $mytable where id=0;":1:1:1:1:S©L>
®   -   Example: <©N®1®1®®©>
§    -   Example: <§VAR§>
˜    -   Example: <˜©˜>  Please note that '˜' is not '~' (tilde)!



Also for convenience you can find some blank templates that you can copy and paste:

* Template place:
<©N®1®1®®©>
place your template here
<˜©˜>


* SQL template
<S©L:1:"SQL query here":1:1:1:1:S©L>


* SQL variable
<S©LVAR:1:S©L>


* Template variable
<§VAR§>


* Begin INLINE
<!--©INLINE©>


* End INLINE
</©INLINE©-->


* Begin INPERL
<!--©INPERL©>


* End INPERL
</©INPERL©-->


* Include statement
<!--©INCLUDE©file.ext©-->


* Inline template
<§TEMPLATE:2:$val:§>


* Inline XREADER
<XREADER:1:bestbuy.jhtml:$first_param,$second_param>


* Inline MENUSELECT
<MENUSELECT:$source:"SQL query here":$ptr_DB:$ptr_TEMPLATE:$ptr_HTML:$dbh:>


* Template destination (target point)
<§TEMPLATE:1§>
